awd_titl_txt: Research on Transient Heat Flow Through Thin Non-Metallic   Coatings Applied to Substrates
awd_abstract_narration: Thin coatings are applied to surfaces to prevent oxidation, to                  control radiation heat losses, to protect against corrosion, etc.               The thermophysical properties of the coatings are needed for                    accurate design work.  However, special techniques have to be                   employed for accurate determination of the properties.                                                                                                          The proposed work is aimed at formulating and implementing a                    technique for the accurate measurements of the thermal                          diffusivity and thermal conductivity of thin-film coatings.  Once               developed, the technique will be applied to coating-substrate                   systems of industrial relevance.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
